title: Before I Fall

quote: If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can’t be in books.
author: Gary Paulsen
title: The Winter Room

quote: This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?
author: John Keats
title: Letters of John Keats

quote: A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: If you're texting Magnus to say 'I think u r kewl,' I'm going to kill you."
author: Cassandra Clare
title: City of Glass

quote: I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I think there should be a rule that everyone in the world should get a standing ovation at least once in their lives.
author: R.J. Palacio
title: Wonder

quote: Well, she's not responding to my advances," he observed more brightly than he felt, "so she must be dead."
author: Cassandra Clare
title: Clockwork Angel

quote: He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.
author: Markus Zusak
title: The Book Thief

quote: It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone.
author: John Steinbeck
title: The Winter of Our Discontent

quote: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won't come in.
author: Alan Alda

quote: For to know a man's library is, in some measure, to know his mind.
author: Geraldine Brooks
title: March

quote: Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.
author: Margaret Atwood
title: Cat's Eye

quote: An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.
author: Alan Moore
title: V for Vendetta

quote: The thing I realize is, that it's not what you take, it's what you leave.
author: Jennifer Niven
title: All the Bright Places

quote: The soul is healed by being with children.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.
author: Cheris Kramarae

quote: Well-read people are less likely to be evil.
author: Lemony Snicket
title: The Slippery Slope

quote: Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.
author: Betty Smith
title: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn

quote: Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.
author: W.E.B. DuBois

quote: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: How long was I asleep?" she whispered. He didn't respond.
author: Sarah J. Maas
title: Throne of Glass

quote: Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: All thinking men are atheists.
author: Ernest Hemingway
title: A Farewell to Arms

quote: Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.
author: Mae West

quote: Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: You could say sorry," suggested Harry bluntly.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

quote: Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old.
author: John Green
title: Paper Towns

quote: Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do.
author: Terry McMillan
title: Disappearing Acts

quote: Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten.
author: Donald E. Westlake
title: Two Much

quote: I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.
author: David Henry Hwang
title: M. Butterfly

quote: Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.
author: Philip José Farmer

quote: It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The Complete Prose Works Of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Life is a mirror: if you frown at it, it frowns back; if you smile, it returns the greeting.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
author: C.G. Jung

quote: Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.
author: Anais Nin

quote: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.
author: Victor Hugo
title: The Hunchback of Notre-Dame

quote: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.
author: Zig Ziglar
title: Raising Positive Kids in a Negative World

quote: There are much worse games to play.
author: Suzanne Collins
title: Mockingjay

quote: We shall meet in the place where there is no darkness.
author: George Orwell

quote: Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.
author: Nicholas Sparks
title: Message in a Bottle

quote: The unfed mind devours itself.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Maybe this world is another planet’s hell.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Gus: "It tastes like..."
author: John Green
title: The Fault in Our Stars

quote: What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.
author: Tennessee Williams
title: A Streetcar Named Desire

quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: No good deed goes unpunished.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: When I look at my life and its secret colours, I feel like bursting into tears.
author: Albert Camus
title: A Happy Death

quote: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.
author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

quote: The purpose of a storyteller is not to tell you how to think, but to give you questions to think upon.
author: Brandon Sanderson
title: The Way of Kings

quote: Some things in life are out of your control. You can make it a party or a tragedy.
author: Nora Roberts
title: Vision in White

quote: There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay.
author: Gayle Forman
title: If I Stay

quote: If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough.
author: David Levithan
title: Every Day

quote: Will rolled up his sleeves. "We'll probably have to knock down the door--"
author: Cassandra Clare
title: Clockwork Angel

quote: God alert!" Blackjack yelled. "It's the wine dude!
author: Rick Riordan
title: The Titan's Curse

quote: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Have you tried talking to her?"
author: Cassandra Clare
title: City of Glass

quote: We sometimes encounter people, even perfect strangers, who begin to interest us at first sight, somehow suddenly, all at once, before a word has been spoken.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
title: Crime and Punishment

quote: District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.
author: Suzanne Collins
title: The Hunger Games

quote: Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: Eleven Minutes

quote: He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.
author: Gabriel García Márquez
title: Love in the Time of Cholera

quote: I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.
author: Nadezhda Mandelstam
title: Hope Against Hope

quote: Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.
author: Terry Pratchett
title: Reaper Man

quote: We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
title: The Scarlet Letter

quote: There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it.
author: Judith McNaught
title: Remember When

quote: You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?
author: Mark Twain

quote: I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: That which you believe becomes your world.
author: Richard Matheson
title: What Dreams May Come

quote: All right," said Susan. "I'm not stupid. You're saying humans need...
author: Terry Pratchett
title: Hogfather

quote: It is not the length of life, but the depth.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: When you read a book, you hold another's mind in your hands.
author: James Burke

quote: I write differently from what I speak, I speak differently from what I think, I think differently from the way I ought to think, and so it all proceeds into deepest darkness.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: When people say impossible, they usually mean improbable.
author: Leigh Bardugo
title: Siege and Storm

quote: When someone you love dies, and you're not expecting it, you don't lose her all at once; you lose her in pieces over a long time—the way the mail stops coming, and her scent fades from the pillows and even from the clothes in her closet and drawers. Gradually, you accumulate the parts of her that are gone. Just when the day comes—when there's a particular missing part that overwhelms you with the feeling that she's gone, forever—there comes another day, and another specifically missing part.
author: John Irving
title: A Prayer for Owen Meany

quote: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
title: The Boscombe Valley Mystery - a Sherlock Holmes Short Story

quote: So light a fire!" Harry choked. "Yes...of course...but there's no wood!" ...
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

quote: It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.
author: George Orwell

quote: You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.
author: Neil Gaiman
title: The Sandman, Vol. 1: Preludes & Nocturnes

quote: The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick
title: Crescendo

quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

quote: The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.
author: George R.R. Martin
title: A Game of Thrones

quote: Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.
author: George R.R. Martin
title: A Game of Thrones

quote: There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something. You certainly usually find something, if you look, but it is not always quite the something you were after.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Hobbit

quote: She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life.
author: Art Spiegelman
title: Maus I: A Survivor's Tale: My Father Bleeds History

quote: The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up ’cause they’re looking for ideas.
author: Paula Poundstone

quote: The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation."
author: Charlotte Brontë
title: Jane Eyre

quote: Humor is reason gone mad.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book… or you take a trip… and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernating becomes dangerous and might degenerate into death): absence of pleasure. That is all. It appears like an innocuous illness. Monotony, boredom, death. Millions live like this (or die like this) without knowing it. They work in offices. They drive a car. They picnic with their families. They raise children. And then some shock treatment takes place, a person, a book, a song, and it awakens them and saves them from death. Some never awaken.
author: Anaïs Nin
title: The Diary of Anaïs Nin, Vol. 1: 1931-1934

quote: A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?"
author: Chuck Palahniuk
title: Survivor

quote: Ignite, my love. Ignite.
author: Tahereh Mafi
title: Ignite Me

quote: I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.
author: Alyson Noel
title: Evermore

quote: But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday," that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise.
author: Stephen R. Covey
title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change

quote: One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk.
author: Charles Baudelaire
title: Paris Spleen

quote: A short story is a different thing altogether – a short story is like a quick kiss in the dark from a stranger.
author: Stephen King
title: Skeleton Crew

quote: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
author: Judy Garland

quote: Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer
title: Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close

quote: But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does.
author: John Green
title: The Fault in Our Stars

quote: Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.
author: Ayn Rand
title: The Fountainhead

quote: In the world I am
author: Bei Dao

quote: Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.
author: Plato

quote: Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war
author: John Green
title: Looking for Alaska

quote: She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.
author: Veronica Roth
title: Divergent

quote: Does such a thing as 'the fatal flaw,' that showy dark crack running down the middle of a life, exist outside literature? I used to think it didn't. Now I think it does. And I think that mine is this: a morbid longing for the picturesque at all costs.
author: Donna Tartt
title: The Secret History

quote: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present.
author: Albert Camus
title: Notebooks 1935-1942

quote: And Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human. So she was turned into a pillar of salt. So it goes.
author: Kurt Vonnegut
title: Slaughterhouse-Five

quote: I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul.
author: Pablo Neruda
title: 100 Love Sonnets

quote: Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: The Little Prince

quote: There is no such thing as a "broken family." Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: I opened myself to the gentle indifference of the world.
author: Albert Camus
title: L'Étranger

quote: Unfortunately, the clock is ticking, the hours are going by. The past increases, the future recedes. Possibilities decreasing, regrets mounting.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: Dance Dance Dance

quote: I'm always happy," Sasha said. "Sometimes I just forget.
author: Jennifer Egan
title: A Visit from the Goon Squad

quote: I want everyone to meet you. You're my favorite person of all time.
author: Rainbow Rowell
title: Eleanor & Park

quote: The mountains are calling and I must go.
author: John Muir

quote: To survive, you must tell stories.
author: Umberto Eco
title: The Island of the Day Before

quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: When you go into the ER, one of the first things they ask you to do is rate your pain on a scale of one to ten, and from there they decide which drugs to use and how quickly to use them. I'd been asked this question hundreds of times over the years, and I remember once early on when I couldn't get my breath and it felt like my chest was on fire, flames licking the inside of my ribs fighting for a way to burn out of my body, my parents took me to the ER. nurse asked me about the pain, and I couldn't even speak, so I held up nine fingers.
author: John Green
title: The Fault in Our Stars

quote: I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless.
author: Veronica Roth
title: Divergent

quote: What's up?" I asked.
author: Richelle Mead
title: Shadow Kiss

quote: We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Lord, what fools these mortals be!
author: William Shakespeare
title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

quote: You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.
author: Gilles Deleuze
title: A Thousand Plateaus: Capitalism and Schizophrenia

quote: There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.
author: Oscar Wilde
title: A Woman of No Importance

quote: It takes something more than intelligence to act intelligently.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
title: Crime and Punishment

quote: There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.
author: Albert Dietrich
title: Army GI, Pacifist CO: The World War II Letters of Frank Dietrich and Albert Dietrich

quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Fire-breathing bitch-queen.
author: Sarah J. Maas
title: Queen of Shadows

quote: Stop fighting me!" he said, trying to pull on the arm he held.
author: Richelle Mead
title: Blood Promise

quote: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius
title: Confucius: The Analects

quote: What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.
author: Doris Lessing
title: The Golden Notebook

quote: We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: History does not always repeat itself. Sometimes it just yells, 'Can't you remember anything I told you?' and lets fly with a club.
author: John W. Campbell Jr.

quote: I am a forest, and a night of dark trees: but he who is not afraid of my darkness, will find banks full of roses under my cypresses.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra

quote: Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!
author: Maya Angelou

quote: This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.
author: David Nicholls
title: One Day

quote: The mind I love must have wild places.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose.
author: Joseph Conrad
title: An Outcast of the Islands

quote: Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.
author: Thomas Pynchon

quote: Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.
author: Roberto Bolaño

quote: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.
author: Mark Twain

quote: When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.
author: Mae West

quote: Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?
author: Julie Kagawa
title: The Iron King

quote: Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: If I am not good to myself, how can I expect anyone else to be good to me?
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity. The greatest problem with communication is we don’t listen to understand. We listen to reply. When we listen with curiosity, we don’t listen with the intent to reply. We listen for what’s behind the words.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Tiger got to hunt, bird got to fly;
author: Kurt Vonnegut
title: Cat's Cradle

quote: Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.
author: Marvin Bell

quote: Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!
author: Mark A. Cooper
title: Operation Einstein

quote: So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
author: George Washington

quote: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
author: Pablo Picasso
title: Pablo Picasso: Metamorphoses of the Human Form : Graphic Works, 1895-1972

quote: If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day.
author: Emily Brontë
title: Wuthering Heights

quote: I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!
author: Adolf Hitler

quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Passion makes a person stop eating, sleeping, working, feeling at peace. A lot of people are frightened because, when it appears, it demolishes all the old things it finds in its path.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: Eleven Minutes

quote: Poetry is what gets lost in translation.
author: Robert Frost

quote: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: I hope you find someone you can't live without.I really do. And I hope you never have to know what it's like to have to try and live without them.
author: Kiera Cass
title: The Selection

quote: Seventeen, eh!" said Hagrid as he accepted a bucket-sized glass of wine from Fred.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quote: To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
title: Eat, Pray, Love: One Woman's Search for Everything

quote: You're something between a dream and a miracle.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.
author: Jack Kerouac
title: On the Road

quote: I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.
author: John Green
title: Looking for Alaska

quote: And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened.
author: Douglas Coupland
title: Life After God

quote: Life is like a prism. What you see depends on how you turn the glass.
author: Jonathan Kellerman

quote: When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.
author: John Green
title: Will Grayson, Will Grayson

quote: Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.
author: Dean Koontz
title: Fear Nothing

quote: You have everything needed for the extravagant journey that is your life.
author: Carlos Castaneda

quote: Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.
author: e.e. cummings

quote: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: Don't let the muggles get you down.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

quote: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: I'm going to keep going until I succeed — or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quote: I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.
author: Rose Wilder Lane

quote: The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.
author: Napoleon Hill
title: Think and Grow Rich

quote: Ideally, what should be said to every child, repeatedly, throughout his or her school life is something like this: 'You are in the process of being indoctrinated. We have not yet evolved a system of education that is not a system of indoctrination. We are sorry, but it is the best we can do. What you are being taught here is an amalgam of current prejudice and the choices of this particular culture. The slightest look at history will show how impermanent these must be. You are being taught by people who have been able to accommodate themselves to a regime of thought laid down by their predecessors. It is a self-perpetuating system. Those of you who are more robust and individual than others will be encouraged to leave and find ways of educating yourself — educating your own judgements. Those that stay must remember, always, and all the time, that they are being moulded and patterned to fit into the narrow and particular needs of this particular society.
author: Doris Lessing
title: The Golden Notebook

quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

quote: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.
author: Woody Allen

quote: I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.
author: H.L. Mencken

quote: Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.
author: John Green
title: Paper Towns

quote: Because,' she said, 'when you're scared but you still do it anyway,
author: Neil Gaiman
title: Coraline

quote: We are always the same age inside.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.
author: J.D. Salinger
title: The Catcher in the Rye

quote: When we are children we seldom think of the future. This innocence leaves us free to enjoy ourselves as few adults can. The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.
author: Patrick Rothfuss
title: The Name of the Wind

quote: Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.
author: Ken Kesey
title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

quote: The sad truth is the truth is sad.
author: Lemony Snicket
title: The Hostile Hospital

quote: We live as we dream--alone....
author: Joseph Conrad
title: Heart of Darkness

quote: I restore myself when I'm alone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
author: Jennifer Niven
title: All the Bright Places

quote: If you want to be happy, be.
author: Tolstoy Leo

quote: The Darkling slumped back in his chair. “Fine,” he said with a weary shrug. “Make me your villain.
author: Leigh Bardugo
title: Shadow and Bone

quote: Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.
author: Oscar Wilde
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: Push yourself. Don't Settle. Just live well. Just LIVE.
author: Jojo Moyes
title: Me Before You

quote: As long as she thinks of a man, nobody objects to a woman thinking.
author: Virginia Woolf
title: Orlando

quote: I am not an angel,' I asserted; 'and I will not be one till I die: I will be myself. Mr. Rochester, you must neither expect nor exact anything celestial of me - for you will not get it, any more than I shall get it of you: which I do not at all anticipate.
author: Charlotte Brontë
title: Jane Eyre

quote: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon
title: Dance with the Devil

quote: I just want you to know that you’re very special… and the only reason I’m telling you is that I don’t know if anyone else ever has.
author: Stephen Chbosky
title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quote: Nothing on earth can make up for the loss of one who has loved you.
author: Selma Lagerlöf

quote: Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand
author: Hayley Williams

quote: What is honor compared to a woman's love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms . . . or the memory of a brother's smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.
author: George R.R. Martin
title: A Game of Thrones

quote: I don't want to be married just to be married. I can't think of anything lonelier than spending the rest of my life with someone I can't talk to, or worse, someone I can't be silent with.
author: Mary Ann Shaffer
title: The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society

quote: If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing.
author: Sherman Alexie
title: The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian

quote: You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift.
author: Erin Morgenstern
title: The Night Circus

quote: Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.
author: Sarah Dessen
title: This Lullaby

quote: Poetry is what happens when nothing else can.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way.
author: Jane Austen
title: Emma

quote: Spring is the time of plans and projects.
author: Leo Tolstoy
title: Anna Karenina

quote: Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane
author: Rachel Caine
title: Glass Houses

quote: Question everything. Your love, your religion, your passion. If you don't have questions, you'll never find answers.
author: Colleen Hoover
title: Slammed

quote: There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, 'There now, hang on, you'll get over it.' Sadness is more or less like a head cold- with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.
author: Barbara Kingsolver
title: The Bean Trees

quote: If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?
author: George Carlin

quote: Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Alchemist

quote: If I should have a daughter…“Instead of “Mom”, she’s gonna call me “Point B.” Because that way, she knows that no matter what happens, at least she can always find her way to me. And I’m going to paint the solar system on the back of her hands so that she has to learn the entire universe before she can say “Oh, I know that like the back of my hand.
author: Sarah Kay

quote: If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.
author: Lewis Caroll
title: Alice in Wonderland

quote: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Can you be a girl for a few seconds?"
author: Veronica Roth
title: Divergent

quote: True friends are always together in spirit.
author: L.M. Montgomery
title: Anne of Green Gables

quote: I didn’t go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly don’t recommend Christianity.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: My only love sprung from my only hate!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I address you all tonight for who you truly are: wizards, mermaids, travelers, adventurers, and magicians. You are the true dreamers.
author: Brian Selznick
title: The Invention of Hugo Cabret

quote: Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig.
author: Robert Heinlein
title: Time Enough for Love

quote: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation. What is called resignation is confirmed desperation. From the desperate city you go into the desperate country, and have to console yourself with the bravery of minks and muskrats. A stereotyped but unconscious despair is concealed even under what are called the games and amusements of mankind. There is no play in them, for this comes after work. But it is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things..
author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Civil Disobedience and Other Essays

quote: I clench his hands to the point of pain. "Stay with me."
author: Suzanne Collins
title: Mockingjay

quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
author: Ben Okri

quote: People are capable, at any time in their lives, of doing what they dream of.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Alchemist

quote: I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.
author: Walter Tevis

quote: One must dare to be happy.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Don't waste your love on somebody, who doesn't value it.
author: William Shakespeare
title: Romeo and Juliet

quote: You think the dead we loved ever truly leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

quote: Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary.
author: Tamora Pierce
title: Lady Knight

quote: A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I just want to be wonderful.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: People, generally, suck.
author: Christopher Moore
title: The Stupidest Angel: A Heartwarming Tale of Christmas Terror

quote: Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage that a soldier needs. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: You - you alone will have the stars as no one else has them...In one of the stars I shall be living. In one of them I shall be laughing. And so it will be as if all the stars were laughing, when you look at the sky at night...You - only you - will have stars that can laugh.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: El Principito

quote: I find out a lot about myself by sleeping. Dreams, they are who I am when I’m too tired to be me.
author: Jarod Kintz
title: This Book is Not for Sale

quote: One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent. To sit with a dog on a hillside on a glorious afternoon is to be back in Eden, where doing nothing was not boring--it was peace.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: sex is the consolation you have when you can't have love
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. "No, I won't let you." "Trust me," I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. "On the count of three?" Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. "The count of three," he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. "Hold them out. I want everyone to see," he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. "One." Maybe I'm wrong. "Two." Maybe they don't care if we both die. "Three!" It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. "Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!
author: Suzanne Collins
title: The Hunger Games

quote: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.
author: Suzanne Collins
title: The Hunger Games

quote: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
author: Robert Frost

quote: I have accepted fear as part of life – specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....
author: Erica Jong

quote: None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have faith.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: People speak sometimes about the "bestial" cruelty of man, but that is terribly unjust and offensive to beasts, no animal could ever be so cruel as a man, so artfully, so artistically cruel.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Demons run when a good man goes to war
author: Steven Moffat

quote: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.
author: Nora Roberts

quote: Sleep, those little slices of death — how I loathe them.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: Kafka on the Shore

quote: I will take the sun in my mouth
author: E.E. Cummings
title: Poems, 1923-1954

quote: I like it when a flower or a little tuft of grass grows through a crack in the concrete. It's so fuckin' heroic.
author: George Carlin

quote: That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: الحداد ليس في ما نرتديه بل في ما نراه . إنّه يكمن في نظرتنا
author: أحلام مستغانمي
title: الأسود يليق بك

quote: When they asked me what I wanted to be I said I didn’t know.
author: Sylvia Plath
title: The Bell Jar

quote: This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.
author: James Lecesne

quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: A single person is missing for you, and the whole world is empty.
author: Philippe Ariès

quote: I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.
author: Chaim Potok
title: The Chosen

quote: If the person you are talking to doesn't appear to be listening, be patient. It may simply be that he has a small piece of fluff in his ear.
author: A.A. Milne
title: Winnie-the-Pooh

quote: Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!
author: C. J. Cherryh

quote: But the Hebrew word, the word timshel—‘Thou mayest’— that gives a choice. It might be the most important word in the world. That says the way is open. That throws it right back on a man. For if ‘Thou mayest’—it is also true that ‘Thou mayest not.
author: John Steinbeck
title: East of Eden

quote: Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
title: Eat Pray Love: One Woman's Search for Everything Across Italy, India and Indonesia

quote: I don't care," Clary said. "He'd do it for me. Tell me he wouldn't. If I were missing-"
author: Cassandra Clare
title: City of Lost Souls

quote: The past beats inside me like a second heart.
author: John Banville
title: The Sea

quote: It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere.
author: Lois Lowry

quote: Black hair and blue eyes are my favorite combination.
author: Cassandra Clare
title: Clockwork Angel

quote: Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element.
author: Audrey Niffenegger
title: The Time Traveler's Wife

quote: I'm not lost for I know where I am. But however, where I am may be lost.
author: A.A. Milne
title: Winnie-the-Pooh

quote: لا تجزع من جرحك، وإلا فكيف للنور أن يتسلل إلى باطنك؟
author: جلال الدين الرومي

quote: I don't hate you.. I just don't like that you exist
author: Gena Showalter
title: Seduce the Darkness

quote: A man should hear a little music, read a little poetry, and see a fine picture every day of his life, in order that worldly cares may not obliterate the sense of the beautiful which God has implanted in the human soul.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Meditations
